Post_Title: Something my therapist said: it doesn’t matter how often abuse happens, even once is enough to leave lifelong trauma.
post_text:
I’ve been struggling lately with self blame and self loathing. Well, I ALWAYS struggle with it thanks to my nMum’s abuse but lately it’s been worse than normal due to other triggering factors.

Today I had an appointment with my therapist and we were talking about this. During the session, I told her I don’t remember a lot of my abuse so I feel like a fraud. That maybe I’m misremembering or ‘making it up’. That’s when she said that it only takes one or two moments of being treated badly, even if we don’t remember it, for it to leave lifelong trauma.

This was a real eye opener to me because it only proves that even one time abuse can leave trauma. It’s petty logical I suppose, but I’d never thought about it like that before.

Just wanted to share. I hope someone else finds it helpful.

Edit: typos.

Edit 2: Wow, thank you everyone for your comments and awards. It’s bittersweet to see how much this has helped. I’m so, so happy knowing it’s helped, but also sad that so many people suffer. I’m going to do my best to reply to all comments soon!
